<dd><p>TenableSC API Wrapper
The Tenable.sc object is the primary interaction point for users to
interface with Tenable.sc via the pyTenable library.  All of the API
endpoint classes that have been written will be grafted onto this class.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The address of the Tenable.sc instance to connect to.  (NOTE: The
<cite>hos`t parameter will be deprecated in favor of the `url</cite> parameter
in future releases).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>access_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The API access key to use for sessionless authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>adapter</strong> (<em>requests.Adaptor</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a requests session adaptor is needed to ensure connectivity
to the Tenable.sc host, one can be provided here.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>backoff</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#float" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>float</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a 429 response is returned, how much do we want to backoff
if the response didn’t send a Retry-After header.  The default
backoff is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1</span></code> second.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>cert</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The client-side SSL certificate to use for authentication.  This
format could be either a tuple or a string pointing to the
certificate.  For more details, please refer to the
<a class="reference external" href="http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#client-side-certificates">Requests Client-Side Certificates</a> documentation.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use for session authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port number to connect to on the specified host.  The
default is port <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">443</span></code>.  (NOTE: The <cite>port</cite> parameter will be
deprecated in favor of the unified <cite>url</cite> parameter in future
releases).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>retries</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The number of retries to make before failing a request.  The
default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">5</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scheme</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What HTTP scheme should be used for URI path construction.  The
default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https</span></code>.  (NOTE: The <cite>scheme</cite> parameter will be
deprecated in favor of the unified <cite>url</cite> parameter in future
releases).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>secret_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The API secret key to use for sessionless authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>session</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.Session" title="(in Requests v2.26.0)"><em>requests.Session</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a requests Session is provided, the provided session will be
used instead of constructing one during initialization.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ssl_verify</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate on the Tenable.sc instance be verified?
Default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to use for session authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timeout</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The connection timeout parameter informing the library how long to
wait in seconds for a stalled response before terminating the
connection.  If unspecified, the default is 300 seconds.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>A direct connection to Tenable.sc:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tenable.sc</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>A connection to Tenable.sc using SSL certificates:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">cert</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;/path/client.cert&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;/path/client.key&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Using an adaptor to use a passworded certificate (via the immensely
useful <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/m-click/requests_pkcs12">requests_pkcs12</a> adaptor):</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">requests_pkcs12</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Pkcs12Adapter</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">adapter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Pkcs12Adapter</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pkcs12_filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;certificate.p12&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pkcs12_password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;omgwtfbbq!&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">adapter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">adapter</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Using API Keys to communicate to Tenable.sc:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">access_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;key&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">secret_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;key&#39;</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Using context management to handle</p>
<p>For more information, please See Tenable’s <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/index.html">SC API documentation</a> and
the <a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api_best_practices/Content/ScApiBestPractices/AboutScApiBestPrac.htm">SC API Best Practices Guide</a>.</p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.TenableSC.login">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">login</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">username</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">password</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">access_key</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">secret_key</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc.md#TenableSC.login"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.TenableSC.login" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Logs the user into Tenable.sc</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Username</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Password</p></li>
<li><p><strong>access_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – API Access Key</p></li>
<li><p><strong>secret_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – API Secret Key</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>None</p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Using a username &amp;&amp; password:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">port</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">8443</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">login</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;username&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Using API Keys:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">port</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">8443</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">login</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">access_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;ACCESSKEY&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">secret_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;SECRETKEY&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dd><p>Bases: <a class="reference internal" href="tenable.base.md#id1" title="tenable.base.platform.APIPlatform"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.base.platform.APIPlatform</span></code></a></p>
<p>TenableSC API Wrapper
The Tenable.sc object is the primary interaction point for users to
interface with Tenable.sc via the pyTenable library.  All of the API
endpoint classes that have been written will be grafted onto this class.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The address of the Tenable.sc instance to connect to.  (NOTE: The
<cite>hos`t parameter will be deprecated in favor of the `url</cite> parameter
in future releases).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>access_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The API access key to use for sessionless authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>adapter</strong> (<em>requests.Adaptor</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a requests session adaptor is needed to ensure connectivity
to the Tenable.sc host, one can be provided here.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>backoff</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#float" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>float</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a 429 response is returned, how much do we want to backoff
if the response didn’t send a Retry-After header.  The default
backoff is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1</span></code> second.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>cert</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The client-side SSL certificate to use for authentication.  This
format could be either a tuple or a string pointing to the
certificate.  For more details, please refer to the
<a class="reference external" href="http://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/user/advanced/#client-side-certificates">Requests Client-Side Certificates</a> documentation.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use for session authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port number to connect to on the specified host.  The
default is port <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">443</span></code>.  (NOTE: The <cite>port</cite> parameter will be
deprecated in favor of the unified <cite>url</cite> parameter in future
releases).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>retries</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The number of retries to make before failing a request.  The
default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">5</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scheme</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What HTTP scheme should be used for URI path construction.  The
default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">https</span></code>.  (NOTE: The <cite>scheme</cite> parameter will be
deprecated in favor of the unified <cite>url</cite> parameter in future
releases).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>secret_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The API secret key to use for sessionless authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>session</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.Session" title="(in Requests v2.26.0)"><em>requests.Session</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a requests Session is provided, the provided session will be
used instead of constructing one during initialization.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ssl_verify</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate on the Tenable.sc instance be verified?
Default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to use for session authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timeout</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The connection timeout parameter informing the library how long to
wait in seconds for a stalled response before terminating the
connection.  If unspecified, the default is 300 seconds.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>A direct connection to Tenable.sc:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">tenable.sc</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>A connection to Tenable.sc using SSL certificates:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">cert</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;/path/client.cert&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;/path/client.key&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Using an adaptor to use a passworded certificate (via the immensely
useful <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/m-click/requests_pkcs12">requests_pkcs12</a> adaptor):</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">requests_pkcs12</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Pkcs12Adapter</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">adapter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Pkcs12Adapter</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pkcs12_filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;certificate.p12&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pkcs12_password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;omgwtfbbq!&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">adapter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">adapter</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Using API Keys to communicate to Tenable.sc:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">TenableSC</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">access_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;key&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">secret_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;key&#39;</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>

<section id="accept-risks">
<h3>Accept Risks<a class="headerlink" href="#accept-risks" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Accept-Risk-Rule.html">Accept Risk</a> API.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.accept_risks</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.accept_risks.AcceptRiskAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">AcceptRiskAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/accept_risks.md#AcceptRiskAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.accept_risks.AcceptRiskAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.accept_risks.AcceptRiskAPI.apply">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">apply</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repo</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/accept_risks.md#AcceptRiskAPI.apply"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.accept_risks.AcceptRiskAPI.apply" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Applies the accept risk rule for either all repositories, or the
repository specified.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Accept-Risk-Rule.html#AcceptRiskRuleRESTReference-/acceptRiskRule/apply">accept-risk: apply</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">

<li><p><strong>repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A specific repository to apply the rule to.  The default if not
specified is all repositories (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code>).</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">str</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>

</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.accept_risks.AcceptRiskAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">plugin_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repos</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/accept_risks.md#AcceptRiskAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.accept_risks.AcceptRiskAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new accept risk rule.  Either ips, uuids, or asset_list must
be specified.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Accept-Risk-Rule.html#acceptRiskRule_POST">accept-risk: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>plugin_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The plugin to apply the accept risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repos</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – The list of repositories to apply this accept risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_list</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The asset list id to apply the accept risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>comments</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The comment associated to the accept risk rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>expires</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Timestamp. When should the rule expire?  if no expiration is set, the rule
will never expire. If not mentioned, value is -1
(-1 represents December 31st 1969 23:59:59 hours GMT)</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IPs to apply the accept risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port to restrict this accept risk rule to.  The default is
unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>protocol</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The protocol to restrict the accept risk rule to.  The default
is unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>uuids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The agent uuids to apply the accept risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created accept risk rule definition.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Create a rule to accept 97737 on 2 IPs till Aug 25th 2021 00:00 Hrs GMT.</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">rule</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">accept_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">97737</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">ips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.101&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.102&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">expires</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1629849600</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Create a rule to accept 97737 on all IPs on repository 1:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">rule</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">accept_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">97737</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dd><p>Applies the accept risk rule for either all repositories, or the

</div>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id9">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">plugin_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repos</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/accept_risks.md#AcceptRiskAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id9" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new accept risk rule.  Either ips, uuids, or asset_list must
be specified.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Accept-Risk-Rule.html#acceptRiskRule_POST">accept-risk: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>plugin_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The plugin to apply the accept risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repos</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – The list of repositories to apply this accept risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_list</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The asset list id to apply the accept risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>comments</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The comment associated to the accept risk rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>expires</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Timestamp. When should the rule expire?  if no expiration is set, the rule
will never expire. If not mentioned, value is -1
(-1 represents December 31st 1969 23:59:59 hours GMT)</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IPs to apply the accept risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port to restrict this accept risk rule to.  The default is
unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>protocol</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The protocol to restrict the accept risk rule to.  The default
is unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>uuids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The agent uuids to apply the accept risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created accept risk rule definition.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Create a rule to accept 97737 on 2 IPs till Aug 25th 2021 00:00 Hrs GMT.</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">rule</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">accept_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">97737</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">ips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.101&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.102&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">expires</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1629849600</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Create a rule to accept 97737 on all IPs on repository 1:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">rule</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">accept_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">97737</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.alerts">
<span id="tenable-sc-alerts-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.alerts module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.alerts" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="alerts">
<h3>Alerts<a class="headerlink" href="#alerts" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Alert.html">Alert</a> API.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.alerts</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.alerts.AlertAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">AlertAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/alerts.md#AlertAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.alerts.AlertAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.alerts.AlertAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">filters</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/alerts.md#AlertAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.alerts.AlertAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new alert.  The fields below are explicitly checked, however
any additional parameters mentioned in the API docs can be passed to the
document constructor.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Sc-api:’alert</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>create &lt;Alert.html#alert_POST&gt;`</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>*filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a>) – A filter expression.  Refer to the detailed description within
the analysis endpoint documentation for more details on how to
formulate filter expressions.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The type of filters being used.  Must be of type <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lce</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ticket</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">user</span></code>, or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vuln</span></code>.  If no data-type is
specified, then the default of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vuln</span></code> will be set.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name of the alert.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the alert.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trigger</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a>) – A tuple in the filter-tuple format detailing what would
constitute a trigger.  For example: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('sumip',</span> <span class="pre">'=',</span> <span class="pre">'1000')</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>always_exec_on_trigger</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the trigger always execute when the trigger fires, or
only execute when the returned data changes?
Default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the schedule dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how
often to run the alert.  If left unspecified then we will
default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>action</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – <p>The action(s) that will be performed when the alert trigger
fires.  Each action is a dictionary detailing what type of
action to take, and the details surrounding that action.  The
supported type of actions are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">email</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">notifications</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">report</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scan</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">syslog</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ticket</span></code>.  The following
examples lay out each type of action as an example:</p>
<ul>
<li><p>Email action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;email&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;subject&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Email Subject&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Email Body&#39;</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;addresses&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;user1@company.com</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">user2@company.com&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;users&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">}],</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;includeResults&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Notification action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;notification&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example notification&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;users&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">}]}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Report action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;report&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;report&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Scan action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;scan&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;scan&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Syslog action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;syslog&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;host&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;port&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;514&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Syslog Message&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Critical&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Ticket action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ticket&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;assignee&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">},</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;name&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Ticket Name&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;description&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Ticket Description&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;notes&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Ticket Notes&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>The alert resource created.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">alerts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;3,4&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">trigger</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sumip&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&gt;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;100&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Too many High or Critical and Exploitable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">action</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;notification&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Too many High or Crit Exploitable Vulns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;users&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">}]</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">}])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>if</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The alert identifier.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>*filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a>) – A filter expression.  Refer to the detailed description within
the analysis endpoint documentation for more details on how to
formulate filter expressions.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The type of filters being used.  Must be of type <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lce</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ticket</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">user</span></code>, or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vuln</span></code>.  If no data-type is
specified, then the default of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vuln</span></code> will be set.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name of the alert.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the alert.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trigger</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tuple in the filter-tuple format detailing what would
constitute a trigger.  For example: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('sumip',</span> <span class="pre">'=',</span> <span class="pre">'1000')</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>always_exec_on_trigger</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the trigger always execute when the trigger fires, or
only execute when the returned data changes?
Default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the schedule dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how
often to run the alert.  If left unspecified then we will
default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>action</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – The action(s) that will be performed when the alert trigger
fires.  Each action is a dictionary detailing what type of
action to take, and the details surrounding that action.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dd></dl>

<dd><p>Bases: <a class="reference internal" href="#tenable.sc.base.SCEndpoint" title="tenable.sc.base.SCEndpoint"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.sc.base.SCEndpoint</span></code></a></p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id14">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">filters</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/alerts.md#AlertAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id14" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new alert.  The fields below are explicitly checked, however
any additional parameters mentioned in the API docs can be passed to the
document constructor.</p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Sc-api:’alert</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>create &lt;Alert.html#alert_POST&gt;`</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>*filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a>) – A filter expression.  Refer to the detailed description within
the analysis endpoint documentation for more details on how to
formulate filter expressions.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The type of filters being used.  Must be of type <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lce</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ticket</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">user</span></code>, or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vuln</span></code>.  If no data-type is
specified, then the default of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vuln</span></code> will be set.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name of the alert.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the alert.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trigger</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a>) – A tuple in the filter-tuple format detailing what would
constitute a trigger.  For example: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('sumip',</span> <span class="pre">'=',</span> <span class="pre">'1000')</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>always_exec_on_trigger</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the trigger always execute when the trigger fires, or
only execute when the returned data changes?
Default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the schedule dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how
often to run the alert.  If left unspecified then we will
default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>action</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – <p>The action(s) that will be performed when the alert trigger
fires.  Each action is a dictionary detailing what type of
action to take, and the details surrounding that action.  The
supported type of actions are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">email</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">notifications</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">report</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scan</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">syslog</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ticket</span></code>.  The following
examples lay out each type of action as an example:</p>
<ul>
<li><p>Email action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;email&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;subject&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Email Subject&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Email Body&#39;</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;addresses&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;user1@company.com</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">user2@company.com&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;users&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">}],</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;includeResults&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Notification action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;notification&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example notification&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;users&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">}]}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Report action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;report&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;report&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Scan action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;scan&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;scan&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Syslog action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;syslog&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;host&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;port&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;514&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Syslog Message&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Critical&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Ticket action type:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ticket&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;assignee&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">},</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;name&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Ticket Name&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;description&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Ticket Description&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
 <span class="s1">&#39;notes&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Example Ticket Notes&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p>The alert resource created.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">alerts</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;3,4&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">trigger</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;sumip&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&gt;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;100&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Too many High or Critical and Exploitable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">action</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;notification&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;message&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Too many High or Crit Exploitable Vulns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;users&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[{</span><span class="s1">&#39;id&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">}]</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">}])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.analysis">
<span id="tenable-sc-analysis-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.analysis module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.analysis" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="analysis">
<h3>Analysis<a class="headerlink" href="#analysis" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Analysis.html">analysis</a> API.  The analysis area in Tenable.sc is
highly complex and allows for a wide range of varied inputs and outputs.  This
single endpoint has been broken down in pyTenable to several methods in order to
apply some defaults to the expected data-types and options most likely to be
returned.  As the filters are dependent on the tool and data-type that is being
referenced, the best solution to understanding what filters are available when
getting started is to simply pass a known bad filter string and use the
resulting error as an indicator of what’s available.  For example, you could
perform the following action below while attempting to see the available filters
for the mobile data-type when using the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulndetails</span></code> tool:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">mobile</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="s1">&#39;something&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">next</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="gt">Traceback (most recent call last):</span>
  File <span class="nb">&quot;&lt;input&gt;&quot;</span>, line <span class="m">1</span>, in <span class="n">&lt;module&gt;</span>
    <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">next</span><span class="p">()</span>
  File <span class="nb">&quot;tenable/base.py&quot;</span>, line <span class="m">75</span>, in <span class="n">next</span>
    <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_get_page</span><span class="p">()</span>
  File <span class="nb">&quot;tenable/sc/analysis.py&quot;</span>, line <span class="m">43</span>, in <span class="n">_get_page</span>
    <span class="n">resp</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_api</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">post</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;analysis&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">json</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">query</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">json</span><span class="p">()</span>
  File <span class="nb">&quot;tenable/base.py&quot;</span>, line <span class="m">436</span>, in <span class="n">post</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_request</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;POST&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">**</span><span class="n">kwargs</span><span class="p">)</span>
  File <span class="nb">&quot;tenable/base.py&quot;</span>, line <span class="m">379</span>, in <span class="n">_request</span>
    <span class="k">raise</span> <span class="bp">self</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">_error_codes</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">status</span><span class="p">](</span><span class="n">resp</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gr">ForbiddenError</span>: <span class="n">00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000:403 {&quot;type&quot;:&quot;regular&quot;,</span>
<span class="go">&quot;response&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;error_code&quot;:146,&quot;error_msg&quot;:&quot;Invalid parameters specified for</span>
<span class="go">mobile vuln query.  The filter &#39;something&#39; is invalid (valid filters:</span>
<span class="go">repositoryIDs, port, pluginID, familyID, pluginOutput, lastSeen,</span>
<span class="go">lastMitigated, severity, protocol, pluginName, baseCVSSScore,</span>
<span class="go">exploitAvailable, pluginPublished, pluginModified, vulnPublished,</span>
<span class="go">patchPublished, deviceID, mdmType, deviceModel, serialNumber, deviceUser,</span>
<span class="go">deviceVersion, osCPE).&quot;,&quot;warnings&quot;:[],&quot;timestamp&quot;:1545060739}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>The resulting error details specifically what filters can be set.</p>
<p>When it comes to constructing filters, TenableSC uses a common filter structure
for the collapsed filter-set.  This format is in the form of a 3 entry tuple
consisting of (‘filtername’, ‘operator’, ‘value’).  For example, if you’re
looking to set the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pluginID</span></code> filter to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">19506</span></code> the filter would look like
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('pluginID',</span> <span class="pre">'=',</span> <span class="pre">'19506')</span></code>.  Severities are in level of criticality, from 0
(informational) to 4 (critical).  Filters like these can be a string of comma-
separated values to indicate multiple items.  So for high and critical vulns,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('severity',</span> <span class="pre">'=',</span> <span class="pre">'3,4')</span></code> would return only what your looking for.</p>
<p>Asset list calculations in filters are a bit more complex, but still shouldn’t
be too difficult.  Tenable.sc leverages nested pairs for the asset calculations
combined with a operator to define how that pair are to be combined.  Each of
the elements within the pair can further be nested, allowing for some quite
complex asset list math to happen.</p>
<p>On the simple side, if you just want to look for The the combined results of
asset lists 1 or 2, you would perform:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('asset',</span> <span class="pre">'~',</span> <span class="pre">('or',</span> <span class="pre">1,</span> <span class="pre">2))</span></code>.
Note the tilda, informing the filtering engine that it will need to perform some
sort of calculation first.  The tilda is only used when using the asset filter.</p>
<p>Now for a more complex calculation, you could look for the IPs that exist in
both 1 or 2, but not 3:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('asset',</span> <span class="pre">'~',</span> <span class="pre">('and',</span> <span class="pre">('or',</span> <span class="pre">1,</span> <span class="pre">2),</span> <span class="pre">('not',</span> <span class="pre">3)))</span></code>
As you can see it’s just a matter of nesting out from “1 or 2”.  The only new
concept here is the paired tuple for not.  asking for the inverse of an asset
list requires that you wrap it in a tuple with the not operator.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.analysis</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">

<dd><dl class="py method">

<dl class="py method">

<li><p><strong>filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The analysis module provides a more compact way to write filters
to the analysis endpoint.  The purpose here is to aid in more
readable code and reduce the amount of boilerplate that must be
written to support a filtered call to analysis.  The format is
simply a list of tuples.  Each tuple is broken down into
(field, operator, value).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>pages</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The number of pages to query.  Default is all.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>limit</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many entries should be in each page?  Default is 200.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many entries to skip before processing.  Default is 0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>source</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The data source location.  Allowed sources are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cumulative</span></code>
and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">patched</span></code>.  Defaults to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cumulative</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The field to sort the results on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_direction</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The direction in which to sort the results.  Valid settings are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asc</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">desc</span></code>.  The default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asc</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tool</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The analysis tool for formatting and returning a specific view

<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">iplist</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">listmailclients</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">listservices</span></code>,
