<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">listvuln</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">listwebclients</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">listwebservers</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumasset</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumcce</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumclassa</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumclassb</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumclassc</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumcve</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumdnsname</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumfamily</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumiavm</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumid</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumip</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">summsbulletin</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumprotocol</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumremediation</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumseverity</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumuserresponsibility</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumport</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">trend</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulndetails</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulnipdetail</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulnipsummary</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>view</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of vulnerability slice you’d like to have returned.
The returned data can be either <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">new</span></code>, or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">patched</span></code>.
If no view is specified, then the default will be <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>

<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>

</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference internal" href="#tenable.sc.analysis.AnalysisResultsIterator" title="tenable.sc.analysis.AnalysisResultsIterator"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">AnalysisResultsIterator</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>A quick example showing how to get the information for a specific
scan from SecurityCenter.  As the default is for the scan method to
return data from the vulndetails tool, we can handle this without
actually doing anything other than calling</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">vuln</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scan</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vuln</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>To ask for a specific subset of information (like only critical and
exploitable vulns) you’d want to pass the filter tuples into the
query like so:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">vulns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scan</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;4&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>To request a different data format (like maybe an IP summary of
vulns) you just need to specify the appropriate tool:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">ips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scan</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;4&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">tool</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sumip&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">

<li><p><strong>limit</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many entries should be in each page?  Default is 200.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many entries to skip before processing.  Default is 0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>source</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The data source location.  Allowed sources are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cumulative</span></code>

<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">summsbulletin</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumprotocol</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumremediation</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumseverity</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumuserresponsibility</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sumport</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">trend</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulndetails</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulnipdetail</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">vulnipsummary</span></code></p></li>
</ul>

</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>A quick example showing how to get all of the information stored in
SecurityCenter.  As the default is for the vulns method to return
data from the vulndetails tool, we can handle this without actually
doing anything other than calling</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">pprint</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">pprint</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">vuln</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">vulns</span><span class="p">():</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">vuln</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>To ask for a specific subset of information (like only critical and
exploitable vulns) you’d want to pass the filter tuples into the
query like so:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">vulns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">vulns</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;4&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>To request a different data format (like maybe an IP summary of
vulns) you just need to specify the appropriate tool:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">ips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">vulns</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;severity&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;4&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">tool</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sumip&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">vuln</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">analysis</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scan</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>

</pre></div>
</div>

exploitable vulns) you’d want to pass the filter tuples into the
query like so:</p>

<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="gp">... </span>   <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;exploitAvailable&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;=&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;true&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">tool</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sumip&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<section id="asset-lists">
<h3>Asset Lists<a class="headerlink" href="#asset-lists" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html">Assets</a> API.  These items are typically seen
under the <strong>Assets</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.asset_lists</span></code>:</p>

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">list_type</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates an asset-list.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#asset_POST">asset-list: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name for the asset list to create.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>list_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The type of list to create.  Supported values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">combination</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsname</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsnameupload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dynamic</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldapquery</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">static</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticeventfilter</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticvulnfilter</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">templates</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">upload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlist</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlisteventfilter</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlistupload</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>combinations</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An asset combination tuple.  For further information refer to
the asset combination logic described at
<a class="reference internal" href="#module-tenable.sc.analysis" title="tenable.sc.analysis"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.sc.analysis</span></code></a>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of data fields as required for a given asset list type.
Each item within the list should be formatted in the following
way: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'fieldName':</span> <span class="pre">'name',</span> <span class="pre">'fieldValue':</span> <span class="pre">'value'}</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The description for the asset list being created.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dn</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The base DN to use for an LDAP query.  Must also provide a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dns_names</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a DNS asset list, use this attribute to provide
the list of DNS addresses.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>exclude_managed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Determines whether or not managed IPs should be excluded from
the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of filter tuples to use when defining filtered asset
list types.  Follows the same format as filters within the rest
of pyTenable.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A file-like object to use when uploading an asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IP Addresses, CIDRs, and/or IP Address ranges to use
for the purposes of a static asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a event-based asset list, which LCE should be used
to generate the asset list query.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric identifier pertaining to the LDAP server to use for
an LDAP query.  must also provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>prep</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should asset preparation be run after the list is created?  If
unspecified, the default action is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rules</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – <p>For a dynamic asset list, the tuple definition of the rules to
determine what Ips are associated to this asset list.  Rules
follow a similar pattern to the asset combination logic and
are written in a way to follow the same visual methodology as
the UI.</p>
<p>For example, a simple dynamic ruleset may look like:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;any&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;svc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;prod.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Which would match all assets with either svc.company.tld or
prod.company.tld in their DNS names.  Rule gropups can be nested
as well, by supplying a new group tuple instead of a rule:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;any&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;svc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;prod.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;any&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;ip&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.140&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
                <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;ip&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.141&#39;</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>In this example we have nested another group requiring that the
ip may contain either of the values in addition to any of the
DNS rules.</p>
<p>It’s also possible to constrain the rule to a specific plugin or
plugins as well by adding a 4th element in a rule tuple.
Defining them would look like so:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Singular Plugin ID</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;plugintext&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;credentialed&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">19506</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># Multiple Plugin IDs</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;plugintext&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;stuff&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">19506</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">10180</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Available rules are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dns</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exploitAvailable</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exploitFrameworks</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">firstseen</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mac</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">os</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ip</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuid</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lastseen</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">netbioshost</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">netbiosworkgroup</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pluginid</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">plugintext</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">port</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">severity</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sshv1</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sshv2</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tcpport</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">udpport</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">xref</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p>Available operators are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">contains</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">eq</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lt</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lte</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ne</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gt</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gte</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">regex</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pcre</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p>Group alauses are either <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">any</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>.  Any is a logical
or.  All is a logical and.</p></li>
</ul>
</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining an “individual” source_type, the numeric id of the
scan instance to base the query upon.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>search_string</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The search string to use as part of an LDAP Query.  Must also
provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_dir</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines the
direction of the sort to use.  This field must be passed when
defining a sort_field.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines what field
to sort the resulting query on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>source_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The source of the data to query from when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>start_offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The start offset of the filter to use when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tag to associate to the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric id of the template to use.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tool</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When specifying filtered asset list types, the analysis tool to
use for determining what IPs should be included within the
asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>view</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the source_type is “individual”, the view defined what
subset of the data to use.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created asset-list.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)">dict</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">asset</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="nb">list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.delete">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">delete</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.delete"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.delete" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>

<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">delete</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.details">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">details</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">org_id</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.details"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.details" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns the details for a specific asset-list.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#AssetRESTReference-/asset/{id}?orgID={org_id}">asset-list: details</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The identifier for the asset-list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>org_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The organizationID for the asset-list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)">dict</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">asset_id_details</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">details</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">asset_id_details</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.edit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.edit" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Edits an asset-list.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#asset_id_PATCH">asset-list: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id of the asset list to edit.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>combinations</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An asset combination tuple.  For further information refer to
the asset combination logic described at
<a class="reference internal" href="#module-tenable.sc.analysis" title="tenable.sc.analysis"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.sc.analysis</span></code></a>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of data fields as required for a given asset list type.
Each item within the list should be formatted in the following
way: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'fieldName':</span> <span class="pre">'name',</span> <span class="pre">'fieldValue':</span> <span class="pre">'value'}</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The description for the asset list being created.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dn</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The base DN to use for an LDAP query.  Must also provide a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dns_names</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a DNS asset list, use this attribute to provide
the list of DNS addresses.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>exclude_managed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Determines whether or not managed IPs should be excluded from
the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of filter tuples to use when defining filtered asset
list types.  Follows the same format as filters within the rest
of pyTenable.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A file-like object to use when uploading an asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IP Addresses, CIDRs, and/or IP Address ranges to use
for the purposes of a static asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a event-based asset list, which LCE should be used
to generate the asset list query.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric identifier pertaining to the LDAP server to use for
an LDAP query.  must also provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the asset list to create.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>prep</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should asset preparation be run after the list is created?  If
unspecified, the default action is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rules</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – For a dynamic asset list, the tuple definition of the rules to
determine what Ips are associated to this asset list.  Rules
follow a similar pattern to the asset combination logic and
are written in a way to follow the same visual methodology as
the UI.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining an “individual” source_type, the numeric id of the
scan instance to base the query upon.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>search_string</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The search string to use as part of an LDAP Query.  Must also
provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_dir</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines the
direction of the sort to use.  This field must be passed when
defining a sort_field.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines what field
to sort the resulting query on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>source_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The source of the data to query from when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>start_offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The start offset of the filter to use when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tag to associate to the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric id of the template to use.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tool</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When specifying filtered asset list types, the analysis tool to
use for determining what IPs should be included within the
asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of list to create.  Supported values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">combination</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsname</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsnameupload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dynamic</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldapquery</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">static</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticeventfilter</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticvulnfilter</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">templates</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">upload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlist</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlisteventfilter</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlistupload</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>view</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the source_type is “individual”, the view defined what
subset of the data to use.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly updated asset-list.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)">dict</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">asset</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="nb">list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.refresh">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">refresh</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">org_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">repos</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.refresh"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.refresh" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Initiates an on-demand recalculation of the asset list.  Note this
endpoint requires being logged in as an admin user.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#AssetRESTReference-/asset/{id}/refresh">asset-list: refresh</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric identifier of the asset list to refresh.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>org_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The organization associated to the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>*repos</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – Repository ids to perform the recalculation on.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Response of the items that the asset list is associated to.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Perform the refresh against a single repo:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">refresh</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Perform the refresh against many repos:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">refresh</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.share">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">share</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">*</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">groups</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.share"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.share" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Shares the specified asset list to another user group.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#AssetRESTReference-/asset/{id}/share">asset-lists: share</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id for the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>*groups</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id of the group(s) to share to.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The updated asset-list resource.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">share</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">group_1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">group_2</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.tags">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">tags</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.tags"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.asset_lists.AssetListAPI.tags" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>

</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<dl class="py class">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id26">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">AssetListAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id26" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Bases: <a class="reference internal" href="#tenable.sc.base.SCEndpoint" title="tenable.sc.base.SCEndpoint"><code class="xref py py-class docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.sc.base.SCEndpoint</span></code></a></p>
<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id27">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">list_type</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id27" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates an asset-list.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#asset_POST">asset-list: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name for the asset list to create.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>list_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The type of list to create.  Supported values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">combination</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsname</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsnameupload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dynamic</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldapquery</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">static</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticeventfilter</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticvulnfilter</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">templates</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">upload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlist</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlisteventfilter</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlistupload</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>combinations</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An asset combination tuple.  For further information refer to
the asset combination logic described at
<a class="reference internal" href="#module-tenable.sc.analysis" title="tenable.sc.analysis"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.sc.analysis</span></code></a>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of data fields as required for a given asset list type.
Each item within the list should be formatted in the following
way: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'fieldName':</span> <span class="pre">'name',</span> <span class="pre">'fieldValue':</span> <span class="pre">'value'}</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The description for the asset list being created.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dn</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The base DN to use for an LDAP query.  Must also provide a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dns_names</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a DNS asset list, use this attribute to provide
the list of DNS addresses.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>exclude_managed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Determines whether or not managed IPs should be excluded from
the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of filter tuples to use when defining filtered asset
list types.  Follows the same format as filters within the rest
of pyTenable.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A file-like object to use when uploading an asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IP Addresses, CIDRs, and/or IP Address ranges to use
for the purposes of a static asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a event-based asset list, which LCE should be used
to generate the asset list query.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric identifier pertaining to the LDAP server to use for
an LDAP query.  must also provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>prep</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should asset preparation be run after the list is created?  If
unspecified, the default action is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rules</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – <p>For a dynamic asset list, the tuple definition of the rules to
determine what Ips are associated to this asset list.  Rules
follow a similar pattern to the asset combination logic and
are written in a way to follow the same visual methodology as
the UI.</p>
<p>For example, a simple dynamic ruleset may look like:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;any&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;svc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;prod.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Which would match all assets with either svc.company.tld or
prod.company.tld in their DNS names.  Rule gropups can be nested
as well, by supplying a new group tuple instead of a rule:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;any&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;svc.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;dns&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;prod.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;any&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;ip&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.140&#39;</span><span class="p">),</span>
                <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;ip&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.141&#39;</span><span class="p">)))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>In this example we have nested another group requiring that the
ip may contain either of the values in addition to any of the
DNS rules.</p>
<p>It’s also possible to constrain the rule to a specific plugin or
plugins as well by adding a 4th element in a rule tuple.
Defining them would look like so:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Singular Plugin ID</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;plugintext&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;credentialed&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">19506</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># Multiple Plugin IDs</span>
<span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;plugintext&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;contains&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;stuff&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">19506</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">10180</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul>
<li><p>Available rules are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dns</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exploitAvailable</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">exploitFrameworks</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">firstseen</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mac</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">os</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ip</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuid</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lastseen</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">netbioshost</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">netbiosworkgroup</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pluginid</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">plugintext</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">port</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">severity</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sshv1</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sshv2</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tcpport</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">udpport</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">xref</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p>Available operators are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">contains</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">eq</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lt</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lte</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ne</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gt</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">gte</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">regex</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pcre</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p>Group alauses are either <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">any</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>.  Any is a logical
or.  All is a logical and.</p></li>
</ul>
</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining an “individual” source_type, the numeric id of the
scan instance to base the query upon.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>search_string</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The search string to use as part of an LDAP Query.  Must also
provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_dir</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines the
direction of the sort to use.  This field must be passed when
defining a sort_field.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines what field
to sort the resulting query on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>source_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The source of the data to query from when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>start_offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The start offset of the filter to use when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tag to associate to the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric id of the template to use.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tool</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When specifying filtered asset list types, the analysis tool to
use for determining what IPs should be included within the
asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>view</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the source_type is “individual”, the view defined what
subset of the data to use.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created asset-list.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)">dict</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">asset</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="nb">list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">delete</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.delete"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id28" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">delete</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id29">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">details</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">org_id</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.details"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id29" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns the details for a specific asset-list.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#AssetRESTReference-/asset/{id}?orgID={org_id}">asset-list: details</a></p>

<li><p><strong>org_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The organizationID for the asset-list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return.</p></li>
