<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id30">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id30" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Edits an asset-list.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#asset_id_PATCH">asset-list: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id of the asset list to edit.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>combinations</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An asset combination tuple.  For further information refer to
the asset combination logic described at
<a class="reference internal" href="#module-tenable.sc.analysis" title="tenable.sc.analysis"><code class="xref py py-mod docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tenable.sc.analysis</span></code></a>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of data fields as required for a given asset list type.
Each item within the list should be formatted in the following
way: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'fieldName':</span> <span class="pre">'name',</span> <span class="pre">'fieldValue':</span> <span class="pre">'value'}</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The description for the asset list being created.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dn</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The base DN to use for an LDAP query.  Must also provide a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dns_names</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a DNS asset list, use this attribute to provide
the list of DNS addresses.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>exclude_managed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Determines whether or not managed IPs should be excluded from
the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of filter tuples to use when defining filtered asset
list types.  Follows the same format as filters within the rest
of pyTenable.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A file-like object to use when uploading an asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IP Addresses, CIDRs, and/or IP Address ranges to use
for the purposes of a static asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a event-based asset list, which LCE should be used
to generate the asset list query.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric identifier pertaining to the LDAP server to use for
an LDAP query.  must also provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and a
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">search_string</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the asset list to create.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>prep</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should asset preparation be run after the list is created?  If
unspecified, the default action is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rules</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – For a dynamic asset list, the tuple definition of the rules to
determine what Ips are associated to this asset list.  Rules
follow a similar pattern to the asset combination logic and
are written in a way to follow the same visual methodology as
the UI.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining an “individual” source_type, the numeric id of the
scan instance to base the query upon.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>search_string</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The search string to use as part of an LDAP Query.  Must also
provide a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dn</span></code> and an <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_dir</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines the
direction of the sort to use.  This field must be passed when
defining a sort_field.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When defining a filtered asset list type, determines what field
to sort the resulting query on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>source_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The source of the data to query from when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>start_offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The start offset of the filter to use when defining a filtered
asset list type.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tag to associate to the asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The numeric id of the template to use.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tool</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When specifying filtered asset list types, the analysis tool to
use for determining what IPs should be included within the
asset list.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of list to create.  Supported values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">combination</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsname</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dnsnameupload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dynamic</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldapquery</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">static</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticeventfilter</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">staticvulnfilter</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">templates</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">upload</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlist</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlisteventfilter</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">watchlistupload</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>view</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the source_type is “individual”, the view defined what
subset of the data to use.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly updated asset-list.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)">dict</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">asset</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="nb">list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id33">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ldap_query</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ldap_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">dn</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">search_string</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.ldap_query"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id33" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<li><p><strong>dn</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The valid search base to use.</p></li>

</dd>
</dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id34">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">list</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/asset_lists.md#AssetListAPI.list"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id34" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the list of asset list definitions.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Asset.html#AssetRESTReference-/asset">asset-list: list</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return for each asset-list.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>A list of asset-list resources.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)">list</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">asset</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="nb">list</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_lists</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">list</span><span class="p">():</span>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.audit_files">
<span id="tenable-sc-audit-files-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.audit_files module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.audit_files" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="audit-files">
<h3>Audit Files<a class="headerlink" href="#audit-files" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/AuditFile.html">Audit File</a> API and the
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/AuditFile-Template.html">Audit File Template</a> API.  These items are
typically seen under the <strong>Scans: Audit Files</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.audit_files</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.audit_files.AuditFileAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">AuditFileAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/audit_files.md#AuditFileAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.audit_files.AuditFileAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.audit_files.AuditFileAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">audit_file</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">tailoring_file</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/audit_files.md#AuditFileAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.audit_files.AuditFileAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a audit file.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/AuditFile.html#auditFile_POST">audit file: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name of the audit file.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>audit_file</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The file-like object containing the audit file if uploading a
custom audit file.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>benchmark</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the type is set to either SCAP datatype, this specifies the
name of the benchmark.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>data_stream</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using version 1.2 of either SCAP datatype, you must specify
the name of the data stream.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description of for the audit file.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>profile</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the type is set to either SCAP datatype, this specifies the
name of the profile.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tailoring_file</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the SCAP version is set to 1.2, this tailoring file can
optionally be provided.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The audit file template it to use.  If using a template, then no
file is uploaded.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of audit file to upload.  Generally only used when
uploading SCAP content as it will default to the Tenable-created
audit-file format.  Supported SCAP values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scapWindows</span></code>
and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scapLinux</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vars</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a template is specified, then this dictionary specifies the
parameters within the template to customize and what those
values should be.  The values are provided within the template
definition.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>version</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When specifying a SCAP datatype, this informs Tenable.sc what
version of SCAP this audit checklist is.  Supported values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.0</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.1</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.2</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created audit file.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">audit</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">audit_files</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

audit-file format.  Supported SCAP values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scapWindows</span></code>
and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scapLinux</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vars</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If a template is specified, then this dictionary specifies the
parameters within the template to customize and what those
values should be.  The values are provided within the template
definition.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>version</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When specifying a SCAP datatype, this informs Tenable.sc what
version of SCAP this audit checklist is.  Supported values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.0</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.1</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1.2</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly updated audit file.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>

</dl>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.base">
<span id="tenable-sc-base-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.base module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.base" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="common-themes">
<h3>Common Themes<a class="headerlink" href="#common-themes" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<section id="tenable-sc-crud-within-pytenable">
<h4>Tenable.sc CRUD within pyTenable<a class="headerlink" href="#tenable-sc-crud-within-pytenable" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h4>
<p>pyTenable allows for the ability to leverage both the naturalized inputs as well
as passing the raw parameters within the same structure.  In some cases this
doesn’t seem immediately obvious, however allows for the ability to pass
parameters that either haven’t yet been, or in some cases, may never be
interpreted by the library.</p>
<p>For example, in the alerts API, you could pass the snake_cased
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">always_exec_on_trigger</span></code> or you could pass what the API endpoint itself
expects, which is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">executeOnEveryTrigger</span></code>.  The snake-cased version expects a
boolean value, which will be converted into the string value that camelCased
variant expects.  You’ll see this behavior a lot throughout the library, and is
intended to allow you to sidestep most things should you need to.  For example,
in the alerts API again, you may not want to pass a trigger as
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">trigger=('sumip',</span> <span class="pre">'&gt;=',</span> <span class="pre">'100')</span></code> and instead pass as the parameters that are
to be written into the JSON request:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">triggerName='sumip',</span> <span class="pre">triggerOperator='&gt;=',</span> <span class="pre">triggerValue='100'</span></code>.  Both of
these methods will produce the same JSON request, and the the option is yours
to use the right way for the job.</p>
<p>Along these same lines, its possible to see how the JSON documents are being
constructed by simply looking at the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">_constructor</span></code> methods for each
APIEndpoint class.  If pyTenable is getting in your way, you can almost always
sidestep it and pass the exact dictionary you wish to pass on to the API.</p>
</section>
<section id="schedule-dictionaries">
<h4>Schedule Dictionaries<a class="headerlink" href="#schedule-dictionaries" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h4>
<p>A dictionary detailing the repeating schedule within Tenable.sc.  This
dictionary consists of 1 or 3 parameters, depending on the type of schedule.
In all of the definitions except <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ical</span></code>, a  single parameter of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">type</span></code> is
passed with lone of the following values: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ical</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">never</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">rollover</span></code>, and
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">template</span></code>.  If no document is specified, then the default of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">never</span></code> is
assumed.  For repeating scans, you’ll have to use the type of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ical</span></code> and also
specify the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">repeatRule</span></code> parameters as well.  The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">start</span></code>
parameter is an
<a class="reference external" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.3.5">iCal DateTime Form #3</a>
formatted string specifying the date and time in which to start the repeating
event.  The <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">repeatRule</span></code> parameter is an
<a class="reference external" href="https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5545#section-3.3.10">iCal Recurrence Rule</a>
formatted string.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Example Never Declaration:</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;never&#39;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Example daily event starting at 9am Eastern</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ical&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">&#39;start&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;TZID=America/New_York:20190214T090000&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">&#39;repeatRule&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;FREQ=DAILY;INTERVAL=1&#39;</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>Example weekly event every Saturday at 8:30pm Eastern</p></li>
</ul>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="p">{</span>
    <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ical&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">&#39;start&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;TZID=America/New_York:20190214T203000&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="s1">&#39;repeatRule&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SA;INTERVAL=1&#39;</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>There are detailed instructions in the RFC documentation on how to construct
these recurrence rules.  Further there are some packages out there to aid in
converting more human-readable text into recurrence rules, such as the
<a class="reference external" href="https://pypi.org/project/recurrent/">recurrent package</a> for example.</p>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.credentials">
<span id="tenable-sc-credentials-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.credentials module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.credentials" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="credentials">
<h3>Credentials<a class="headerlink" href="#credentials" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Credential.html">Scan Credentials</a> API.  These
items are typically seen under the <strong>Scan Credentials</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.credentials</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI">

Valid types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">database</span></code>,

<li><p><strong>auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The type of authentication for the credential.  Valid types are

Valid values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.k5login</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cisco</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dzdo</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pbrun</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">su</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">su+sudo</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sudo</span></code>.  If left unspecified,
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>public_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the SSH public key or certificate.</p></li>

<li><p><strong>oracle_service_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of service identifier specified in the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sid</span></code>
parameter.  Valid values are either <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sid</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">service_name</span></code>.
If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sid</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sid</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The service identifier or name for a database credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sql_server_auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of authentication to perform to the SQL Server
instance.  Valid values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">SQL</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Windows</span></code>.  The default

<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tag to associate to the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username for the OS credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_domain</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The domain, if set, within Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_organization</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The organization to use if using a cloud instance of Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use when authenticating to Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_private_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If enabled, informs the scanners to use key-based auth for SSH
connections instead of password auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_secret_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The secret name value on the Tycotic server.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_url</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The absolute URL path pointing to the Thycotic secret server.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to use to authenticate to Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
Thycotic?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_account_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The unique name of the credential to retrieve from CyberArk.
Generally referred to as the <em>name</em> parameter within CyberArk.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The domain for the CyberArk account.  SSL must be configured
through IIS on the CCP before using.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_app_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The AppID to use with CyberArk.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_client_cert</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the CyberArk client certificate.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_url</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The URL for the CyberArk AIM web service. If left unspecified,
the default URL path of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/AIMWebservice/v1.1/AIM.asmx</span></code> will be
used..</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_private_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the CyberArk client private key.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_private_key_passphrase</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The passhrase for the private key.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_folder</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The folder to use within CyberArk for credential retrieval.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The CyberArk Vault host.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use for authentication to the vault if
the CyberArk Central Credential Provider is configured for
basic auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_policy_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The CyberArk PolicyID assigned to the credentials to retrieve.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port in which the CyberArk Vault resides.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_safe</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The CyberArk safe that contains the credentials to retrieve.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_use_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the scanners communicate to CyberArk over SSL for
credential retrieval?  If left unspecified, the default is set
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to use for authentication to the vault if
the CyberArk Central Credential Provider is configured for
basic auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
the vault?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created credential.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Creating a Windows AD credential:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example AD User&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;windows&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ntlm&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;scanneruser&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">domain</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Company.com&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a root user SSH credential:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example SSH Cred&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ssh&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a root user SSH cred with a private key:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;privatekeyfile&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;rb&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">keyfile</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;Example SSH Keys&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ssh&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;publickey&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="n">private_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">keyfile</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a normal user SSH cred with sudo for privilege escalation:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example SSH Sudo&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ssh&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;user&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">privilege_escalation</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sudo&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">escalation_password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a SQL Server cred set:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example SQL Server&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;database&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;SQL Server&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sa&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sql_server_auth_type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;SQL&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sid</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;database_name&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI.delete">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">delete</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/credentials.md#CredentialAPI.delete"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI.delete" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Removes a credential.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Credential.html#credential_id_DELETE">credential: delete</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric identifier for the credential to remove.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>An empty response.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">str</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">delete</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI.details">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">details</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/credentials.md#CredentialAPI.details"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI.details" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Returns the details for a specific credential.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Credential.html#CredentialRESTReference-/credential/{id}">credential: details</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The identifier for the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>

</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">details</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cred</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI.edit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/credentials.md#CredentialAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.credentials.CredentialAPI.edit" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Edits a credential.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Credential.html#credential_id_PATCH">credential: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of authentication for the credential.  Valid types are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">beyondtrust</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">certificate</span></code>, cyberark``, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">kerberos</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lieberman</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lm</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ntlm</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">password</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">publickey</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">thycotic</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_api_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The API key to use for authenticating to Beyondtrust.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_duration</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The length of time to cache the checked-out credentials from
Beyondtrust.  This value should be less than the password change
interval within Beyondtrust.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The host address for the Beyondtrust application.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port number associated with the Beyondtrust application.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_use_escalation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If enabled, informs the scanners to use Beyondtrust for
privilege escalation.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_use_private_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If enabled, informs the scanners to use key-based auth for SSH
connections instead of password auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_use_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the scanners communicate to Beyondtrust over SSL for
credential retrieval?  If left unspecified, the default is set
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
Beyondtrust?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>community_string</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The SNMP community string to use for authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>db_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of database connection that will be performed.  Valid
types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">DB2</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Informix/DRDA</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">MySQL</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Oracle</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">PostgreSQL</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">SQL</span> <span class="pre">Server</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description to associate to the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>domain</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Active Directory domain to use if the user is a member of a
domain.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_path</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The path in which to run the escalation commands.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use for the escalation.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_su_use</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If performing an SU escalation, this is the user to escalate to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to escalate to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_ip</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The kerberos host supplying the session tickets.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port to use for kerberos connections.  If left unspecified
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">88</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_protocol</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The protocol to use for kerberos connections.  Valid options are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tcp</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">udp</span></code>.  If left unspecified then the default is
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tcp</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_realm</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Kerberos realm to use for authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The address for the Lieberman vault.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port number where the Lieberman service is listening.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_pam_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to authenticate to the Lieberman RED API.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_pam_user</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to authenticate to the Lieberman RED API.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_system_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the credentials in Lieberman.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_use_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the scanners communicate to Lieberman over SSL for
credential retrieval?  If left unspecified, the default is set
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
Lieberman?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password for the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A valid port number for a database credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>private_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the SSH private key.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>privilege_escalation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of privilege escalation to perform once authenticated.
Valid values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.k5login</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cisco</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dzdo</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pbrun</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">su</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">su+sudo</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sudo</span></code>.  If left unspecified,
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>public_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the SSH public key or certificate.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>oracle_auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of authentication to use when communicating to an
Oracle database server.  Supported values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sysdba</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sysoper</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">normal</span></code>.  If left unspecified, the default
option is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">normal</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>oracle_service_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of service identifier specified in the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sid</span></code>
parameter.  Valid values are either <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sid</span></code> or <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">service_name</span></code>.
If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sid</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sid</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The service identifier or name for a database credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sql_server_auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of authentication to perform to the SQL Server
instance.  Valid values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">SQL</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Windows</span></code>.  The default
value if left unspecified is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">SQL</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A tag to associate to the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>type</strong> (<em>str. optional</em>) – The type of credential to store.  Valid types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">database</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">snmp</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ssh</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">windows</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username for the OS credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_domain</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The domain, if set, within Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_organization</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The organization to use if using a cloud instance of Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use when authenticating to Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_private_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If enabled, informs the scanners to use key-based auth for SSH
connections instead of password auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_secret_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The secret name value on the Tycotic server.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_url</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The absolute URL path pointing to the Thycotic secret server.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to use to authenticate to Thycotic.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>thycotic_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
Thycotic?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_account_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The unique name of the credential to retrieve from CyberArk.
Generally referred to as the <em>name</em> parameter within CyberArk.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The domain for the CyberArk account.  SSL must be configured
through IIS on the CCP before using.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_app_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The AppID to use with CyberArk.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_client_cert</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the CyberArk client certificate.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_url</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The URL for the CyberArk AIM web service. If left unspecified,
the default URL path of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">/AIMWebservice/v1.1/AIM.asmx</span></code> will be
used..</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_private_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the CyberArk client private key.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_cyberark_private_key_passphrase</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The passhrase for the private key.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_folder</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The folder to use within CyberArk for credential retrieval.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The CyberArk Vault host.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use for authentication to the vault if
the CyberArk Central Credential Provider is configured for
basic auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_policy_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The CyberArk PolicyID assigned to the credentials to retrieve.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port in which the CyberArk Vault resides.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_safe</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The CyberArk safe that contains the credentials to retrieve.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_use_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the scanners communicate to CyberArk over SSL for
credential retrieval?  If left unspecified, the default is set
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to use for authentication to the vault if
the CyberArk Central Credential Provider is configured for
basic auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vault_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
the vault?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly updated credential.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>

<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>
