</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Creating a Windows AD credential:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example AD User&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;windows&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ntlm&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;scanneruser&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">domain</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Company.com&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a root user SSH credential:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example SSH Cred&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ssh&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a root user SSH cred with a private key:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;privatekeyfile&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;rb&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">keyfile</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;Example SSH Keys&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ssh&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;publickey&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="n">private_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">keyfile</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a normal user SSH cred with sudo for privilege escalation:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example SSH Sudo&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ssh&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;user&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">privilege_escalation</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sudo&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">escalation_password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a SQL Server cred set:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Example SQL Server&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;database&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;SQL Server&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sa&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">password</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;sekretpassword&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sql_server_auth_type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;SQL&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sid</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;database_name&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id51">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">delete</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/credentials.md#CredentialAPI.delete"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id51" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Removes a credential.</p>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric identifier for the credential to remove.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>An empty response.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">str</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">delete</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id52">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">details</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/credentials.md#CredentialAPI.details"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id52" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>

<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">cred</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">credentials</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">details</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">cred</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id53">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/credentials.md#CredentialAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id53" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Edits a credential.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Credential.html#credential_id_PATCH">credential: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of authentication for the credential.  Valid types are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">beyondtrust</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">certificate</span></code>, cyberark``, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">kerberos</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lieberman</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lm</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ntlm</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">password</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">publickey</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">thycotic</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_api_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The API key to use for authenticating to Beyondtrust.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_duration</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The length of time to cache the checked-out credentials from
Beyondtrust.  This value should be less than the password change
interval within Beyondtrust.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The host address for the Beyondtrust application.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port number associated with the Beyondtrust application.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_use_escalation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If enabled, informs the scanners to use Beyondtrust for
privilege escalation.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_use_private_key</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If enabled, informs the scanners to use key-based auth for SSH
connections instead of password auth.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_use_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the scanners communicate to Beyondtrust over SSL for
credential retrieval?  If left unspecified, the default is set
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>beyondtrust_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
Beyondtrust?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>community_string</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The SNMP community string to use for authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>db_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of database connection that will be performed.  Valid
types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">DB2</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Informix/DRDA</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">MySQL</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Oracle</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">PostgreSQL</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">SQL</span> <span class="pre">Server</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description to associate to the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>domain</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Active Directory domain to use if the user is a member of a
domain.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_path</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The path in which to run the escalation commands.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to use for the escalation.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_su_use</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If performing an SU escalation, this is the user to escalate to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>escalation_username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to escalate to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_ip</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The kerberos host supplying the session tickets.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port to use for kerberos connections.  If left unspecified
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">88</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_protocol</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The protocol to use for kerberos connections.  Valid options are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tcp</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">udp</span></code>.  If left unspecified then the default is
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tcp</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>kdc_realm</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Kerberos realm to use for authentication.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_host</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The address for the Lieberman vault.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port number where the Lieberman service is listening.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_pam_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password to authenticate to the Lieberman RED API.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_pam_user</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username to authenticate to the Lieberman RED API.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_system_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the credentials in Lieberman.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_use_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the scanners communicate to Lieberman over SSL for
credential retrieval?  If left unspecified, the default is set
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lieberman_verify_ssl</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the SSL certificate be validated when communicating to
Lieberman?  If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The password for the credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A valid port number for a database credential.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>private_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the SSH private key.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>privilege_escalation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of privilege escalation to perform once authenticated.
Valid values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">.k5login</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">cisco</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dzdo</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">pbrun</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">su</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">su+sudo</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sudo</span></code>.  If left unspecified,
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>public_key</strong> (<em>file</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The fileobject containing the SSH public key or certificate.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>oracle_auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of authentication to use when communicating to an
Oracle database server.  Supported values are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sysdba</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sysoper</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">normal</span></code>.  If left unspecified, the default
option is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">normal</span></code>.</p></li>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.organizations.OrganizationAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/organizations.md#OrganizationAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.organizations.OrganizationAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Create a new organization</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Organization.html#organization_POST">SC Organization Create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name for organization.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>info_links</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of custom analysis links provided to users within the
host vulnerability details when analyzing data outside of
SecurityCenter is desired.  Links shall be described in a tuple
format with <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">(name,</span> <span class="pre">link)</span></code> format.  For example:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('SANS',</span> <span class="pre">'https://isc.sans.edu/ipinfo.html?ip=%IP%')</span></code></p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_ids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What Log Correlation Engines (if any) should this organization
be allowed to access?  If left unspecified no LCE engined will
be granted to this organization.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_ids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What ldap server configuration ids should be used with this
organization?</p></li>
<li><p><strong>nessus_managers</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Nessus Manager scanner for Nessus Agent scan imports.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>pub_sites</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of publishing site ids to associate this organization.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repos</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of Repository ids to associate to this organization.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>restricted_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IP addresses, CIDRs, and/or IP ranges that should
never be scanned.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vuln_score_low</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The vulnerability weighting to apply to low criticality
vulnerabilities for scoring purposes. (Default: 1)</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vuln_score_medium</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The vulnerability weighting to apply to medium criticality
vulnerabilities for scoring purposes. (Default: 3)</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vuln_score_high</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The vulnerability weighting to apply to high criticality
vulnerabilities for scoring purposes. (Default: 10)</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vuln_score_critical</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The vulnerability weighting to apply to critical criticality
vulnerabilities for scoring purposes.(Default: 40)</p></li>
<li><p><strong>zone_selection</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – What type of scan zone selection should be performed?
Available selection types are as follows: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">auto_only</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">locked</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">selectable+auto</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">selectable+auto_restricted</span></code>.
If left unspecified, the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">auto_only</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>zones</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">zone_selection</span></code> is not <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">auto_only</span></code>, this field
must be filled with list of ids from available scan zone(s).</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The organization resource record for the newly created Org.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Creating a new organization with automatic scan zone selection:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">org</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">organization</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Sample Organization&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a new organization with custom analysis links:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">org</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">organization</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="s1">&#39;Sample Organization&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">info_links</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;SANS&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://isc.sans.edu/ipinfo.html?ip=%IP%&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name for organization.</p></li>

<li><p><strong>pages</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many pages of data should we return.  If none is specified
then all pages will return.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The field to sort the results on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_direction</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The direction in which to sort the results.  Valid settings are

<li><p><strong>type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of plugins to return.  Available types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">active</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">compliance</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">custom</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lce</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">notPassive</span></code>, and
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">passive</span></code>.  If nothing is specified, then <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code> is assumed.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>

<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">plugin</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">plugins</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">plugin</span><span class="p">)</span>

</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id92">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">list</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/plugins.md#PluginAPI.list"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id92" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the list of plugins.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Plugin.html#PluginRESTReference-/plugin">plugins: list</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>filter</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A filter tuple for which to filter the plugins.  Filter tuples
must be <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">('name',</span> <span class="pre">'operator',</span> <span class="pre">'value')</span></code> and follow a similar
yet different format to the analysis filters.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>limit</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many records should be returned in each page of data.  If
none is specified, the default is 1000 records.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>offset</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – At what offset within the data should we start returning data.
If none is specified, the default is 0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>pages</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many pages of data should we return.  If none is specified
then all pages will return.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_field</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The field to sort the results on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>sort_direction</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The direction in which to sort the results.  Valid settings are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asc</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">desc</span></code>.  The default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asc</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The type of plugins to return.  Available types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">active</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">compliance</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">custom</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">lce</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">notPassive</span></code>, and
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">passive</span></code>.  If nothing is specified, then <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code> is assumed.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>an iterator object handling data pagination.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference internal" href="#tenable.sc.plugins.PluginResultsIterator" title="tenable.sc.plugins.PluginResultsIterator">PluginResultsIterator</a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>To retrieve all of the plugins, you’ll simply need to call the list
method like so:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">plugins</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plugins</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">list</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">plugin</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">plugins</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">plugin</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>If you only want the plugins with java in the name, you’d run a
query similar to this one:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">plugins</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plugins</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">list</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="nb">filter</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;name&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;like&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;java&#39;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>For just the active plugins, we’d run:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">plugins</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">plugins</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;active&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.policies">
<span id="tenable-sc-policies-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.policies module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.policies" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="policies">
<h3>Policies<a class="headerlink" href="#policies" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Policy.html">Scan Policies</a> API.  These items are typically seen
under the <strong>Scan Policies</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.policies</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ScanPolicyAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/policies.md#ScanPolicyAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.copy">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">copy</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/policies.md#ScanPolicyAPI.copy"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.copy" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Clones the specified scan policy</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Policy.html#ScanPolicyRESTReference-/policy/{id}/copy">scan-policy: copy</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The unique identifier for the source policy to clone.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name of the new policy.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The scan policy resource record for the newly created policy.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">policy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">policies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10001</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">policy</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/policies.md#ScanPolicyAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new scan policy</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Policy.html#policy_POST">scan-policy: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The Name of the new scan policy</p></li>
<li><p><strong>audit_files</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of audit files (by integer id) to be used for the
scan policy.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An optional description for the policy</p></li>
<li><p><strong>preferences</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A dictionary of settings that override the defaults within a
policy template.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>profile_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The profile of the scan.  Default is an empty string.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>owner_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Define who shall own the policy by that user’s integer identifier</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An optional tag identifier for the policy</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The identifier of the policy template to use.  If none is
specified, the default id for the “Advanced Policy” will be
used.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>xccdf</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should XCCDF results be generated?  The default is False.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The created scan policy resource.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>An example advanced policy with all of the default preferences.</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">policies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Advanced Policy&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>An example policy where we want to modify</p>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">

</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>

<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">policy</span><span class="p">)</span>

</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.edit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/policies.md#ScanPolicyAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.edit" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Edits an existing scan policy</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Policy.html#policy_id_PATCH">scan-policy: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The unique identifier to the scan policy to edit</p></li>
<li><p><strong>audit_files</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of audit files (by integer id) to be used for the
scan policy.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An optional description for the policy</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Name of the new scan policy</p></li>
<li><p><strong>preferences</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A dictionary of settings that override the defaults within a
policy template.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>profile_name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The profile of the scan.  Default is an empty string.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remove_prefs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of preferences to remove from the policy.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>owner_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Define who shall own the policy by that user’s integer identifier</p></li>
<li><p><strong>tags</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – An optional tag identifier for the policy</p></li>
<li><p><strong>template_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The identifier of the policy template to use.  If none is
specified, the default id for the “Advanced Policy” will be
used.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>xccdf</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should XCCDF results be generated?  The default is False.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The updated scan policy resource.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>An example advanced policy with all of the default preferences.</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">policies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10001</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Updated Example Advanced Policy&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>To remove a preference, you would perform the following:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">policies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">10001</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remove_prefs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;scan_malware&#39;</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.export_policy">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">export_policy</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fobj</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/policies.md#ScanPolicyAPI.export_policy"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.policies.ScanPolicyAPI.export_policy" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Export the specified scan policy</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Policy.html#ScanPolicyRESTReference-/policy/{id}/export">scan-policy: export</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The unique identifier for the scan policy to export.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The file-like object to write the resulting file into.  If
no file-like object is provided, a BytesIO objects with the
downloaded file will be returned.  Be aware that the default
option of using a BytesIO object means that the file will be
stored in memory, and it’s generally recommended to pass an
actual file-object to write to instead.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The file-like object with the resulting export.</p>

</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;example_policy.xml&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;wb&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">fobj</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">policies</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">export_policy</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1001</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fobj</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<li><p><strong>*filters</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#tuple" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>tuple</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The filters to use for the query.  Refer to the documentation

<section id="module-tenable.sc.recast_risks">
<span id="tenable-sc-recast-risks-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.recast_risks module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.recast_risks" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="recast-risks">
<h3>Recast Risks<a class="headerlink" href="#recast-risks" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Recast-Risk-Rule.html">Recast Risk</a> API.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.recast_risks</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">RecastRiskAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/recast_risks.md#RecastRiskAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI.apply">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">apply</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">risk_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repo</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/recast_risks.md#RecastRiskAPI.apply"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI.apply" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Applies the recast risk rule for either all repositories, or the
repository specified.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Recast-Risk-Rule.html#RecastRiskRuleRESTReference-/recastRiskRule/apply">recast-risk: apply</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>risk_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The identifier for the recast risk rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A specific repository to apply the rule to.  The default if not
specified is all repositories (<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code>).</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Empty string response from the API.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">str</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">recast_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">plugin_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repos</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">severity_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/recast_risks.md#RecastRiskAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new recast risk rule.  Either ips, uuids, or asset_list must
be specified.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Recast-Risk-Rule.html#recastRiskRule_POST">recast-risk: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>plugin_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The plugin to apply the recast risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repos</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – The list of repositories to apply this recast risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>severity_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The new severity that vulns matching this rule should be recast
to.  Valid values are: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code>: Info, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1</span></code>: Low, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2</span></code>: Medium,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3</span></code>: High, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">4</span></code>: Critical.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_list</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The asset list id to apply the recast risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>comments</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The comment associated to the recast risk rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IPs to apply the recast risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port to restrict this recast risk rule to.  The default is
unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>protocol</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The protocol to restrict the recast risk rule to.  The default
is unrestricted.</p></li>

that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>

</dd>

<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id116">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">plugin_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repos</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">severity_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/recast_risks.md#RecastRiskAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id116" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new recast risk rule.  Either ips, uuids, or asset_list must
be specified.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Recast-Risk-Rule.html#recastRiskRule_POST">recast-risk: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>plugin_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The plugin to apply the recast risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repos</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a>) – The list of repositories to apply this recast risk rule to.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>severity_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The new severity that vulns matching this rule should be recast
to.  Valid values are: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code>: Info, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">1</span></code>: Low, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">2</span></code>: Medium,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3</span></code>: High, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">4</span></code>: Critical.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_list</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The asset list id to apply the recast risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>comments</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The comment associated to the recast risk rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of IPs to apply the recast risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The port to restrict this recast risk rule to.  The default is
unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>protocol</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The protocol to restrict the recast risk rule to.  The default
is unrestricted.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>uuids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The agent uuids to apply the recast risk rule to.  Please note
that <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">asset_list</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ips</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uuids</span></code> are mutually
exclusive.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly created recast risk rule definition.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>

<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">ips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.101&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.102&#39;</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
