<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return for each recast risk rule.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The recast risk rule details.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">rule</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">recast_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">details</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rule</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id119">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">list</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repo_ids</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">plugin_id</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">port</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">org_ids</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/recast_risks.md#RecastRiskAPI.list"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id119" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the list of recasted risk rules.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Recast-Risk-Rule.html#RecastRiskRuleRESTReference-/recastRiskRule">recast-risk: list</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of attributes to return for each recast risk rule.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>plugin_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Plugin id to filter the response on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>port</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Port number to filter the response on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>org_ids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – List of organization ids to filter on.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo_ids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – List of repository ids to filter the response on.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>A list of recast risk rules.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference internal" href="#id119" title="tenable.sc.recast_risks.RecastRiskAPI.list"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">rule</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">recast_risks</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">list</span><span class="p">():</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">pprint</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rule</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</dd></dl>

</section>
</section>
<section id="module-tenable.sc.repositories">
<span id="tenable-sc-repositories-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.repositories module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.repositories" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="repositories">
<h3>Repositories<a class="headerlink" href="#repositories" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction with the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html">Repository</a> API.  These items are typically seen
under the <strong>Repositories</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.repositories</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">RepositoryAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.accept_risk_rules">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">accept_risk_rules</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.accept_risk_rules"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.accept_risk_rules" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the accepted risk rules associated with the specified
repository.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#RepositoryRESTReference-/repository/{id}/acceptRiskRule">repository: accept rules</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>repository_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id of the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The list of fields that are desired to be returned.  For details
on what fields are available, please refer to the details on the
request within the repository accept risk rules API doc.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>List of the accepted risk rules that apply to the repo.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference internal" href="#id130" title="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.list"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">rules</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">accept_risk_rules</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.asset_intersections">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">asset_intersections</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">uuid</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ip_address</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">dns</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.asset_intersections"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.asset_intersections" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the asset lists that a UUID, DNS address, or IP exists in.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#RepositoryRESTReference-/repository/{repository_id}/assetIntersections">repository: asst intersections</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>repository_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric identifier of the repository to query.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dns</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The DNS name to query</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ip_address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The IP address to query</p></li>
<li><p><strong>uuid</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The UUID to query.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The list of assets matching the criteria.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference internal" href="#id130" title="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.list"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">list</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">assetlists</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">asset_intersection</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">ip</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a new repository</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#repository_POST">repository: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name for the respository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>allowed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Allowed IPs will restrict incoming data being inserted into the
repository to only the IPs that exist within the configured
CIDR ranges.  Accepts a list of CIDR strings based on the
repository format (IPv4 or IPv6).  If left unspecified, then it
will default to the CIDR equivalent of “allow all” for that IP
version.  IPv4=0.0.0.0/0, IPv6=::/0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>format</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The format of the repository.  Valid choices are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">agent</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IPv4</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IPv6</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mobile</span></code>.  The default if unspecified
is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IPv4</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fulltext_search</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should full-text searching be enabled?  This option is used for
IPv4, IPv6, and agent repository formats and determins whether
the plugin output is trended along with the normalized data.  If
left unspecified, the default is set to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_correlation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What Log Correlation Engines (if any) should correlate against
this repository.  A list of configured LCE numeric IDs is
supplied.  This option is used on IPv4, IPv6, and agent formats
and is defaulted to nothing if left unspecified.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>nessus_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the .Nessus file generation schedule for IPv4 and IPv6
repository formats.  This option should only be used if there
is a need to consume the Repository in a raw Nessus XML format.
If left unspecified, it will default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>mobile_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, this option will inform
Tenable.sc how often to perform the MDM synchronization into the
repository.  If left unspecified, it will default to
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>orgs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of Organization IDs used to assign the repository to 1 or
many organizations.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>preferences</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using a mobile repository type, this dictionary details
the required preferences to inject into the backend scan needed
to communicate to the MDM solution.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_ip</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the IP
address of the Tenable.sc instance that the repository will be
pulled from.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the numeric ID
of the repository on the remote host that will be pulled.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the schedule
dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how often to synchronize
with the downstream Tenable.sc instance.  If left unspecified
then we will default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What type of repository is this?  Valid choices are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Local</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Remote</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Offline</span></code>.  The default if unspecified is
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Local</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scanner_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, we must specify the
scanner from which to query the MDM source.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trending</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days of trending snapshots should be created for this
repository.  This value is only used for IPv4, IPv6, and agent
repositories.  If not supplied, the default will be 0.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The repository resource record for the newly created Repo.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Creating a new IPv4 Repository leveraging the defaults:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example IPv4&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a new IPv4 Repository with 90 days of trending and linked
to the first Organization:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Trending&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">trending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">90</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orgs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating an IPv6 repository:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example IPv6&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;IPv6&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating an agent repository:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Agent&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;agent&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating an MDM repository for ActiveSync that will sync every day
at 6am eastern:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example ActiveSync&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mdm_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scanner_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;mobile&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orgs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">mobile_sched</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;repeatRule&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;FREQ=DAILY;INTERVAL=1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;start&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;TZID=America/New_York:20190212T060000&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ical&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">},</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">preferences</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;domain&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;AD_DOMAIN&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;domain_admin&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;DA_ACCOUNT_NAME&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;domain_controller&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;dc1.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;DA_ACCOUNT_PASSWORD&#39;</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a new repository to remotely sync the downstream Tenable.sc
instance’s repository 1 to this host and institute trending for 90
days:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Remote Repo&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">repo_type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Remote&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remote_ip</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.101&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remote_repo</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">trending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">90</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">orgs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remote_sched</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ical&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;start&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;TZID=America/NewYork:20190212T060000&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;repeatRule&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;FREQ=DAILY;INTERVAL=1&#39;</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.device_info">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">device_info</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">dns</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ip_address</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">uuid</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.device_info"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.device_info" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the device information for the requested device on the

<dl class="field-list simple">

<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">

<li><p><strong>dns</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The DNS name to query</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The list of fields that are desired to be returned.  For details
on what fields are available, please refer to the details on the
request within the repository device info API doc.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ip_address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The IP address to query</p></li>
<li><p><strong>uuid</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The UUID to query.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The device resource.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">host</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">device_info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ip_address</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.edit">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.edit" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Updates an existing repository</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#repository_id_PATCH">repository: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>repository_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id of the repository to edit.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>allowed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Allowed IPs will restrict incoming data being inserted into the
repository to only the IPs that exist within the configured
CIDR ranges.  Accepts a list of CIDR strings based on the
repository format (IPv4 or IPv6).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_correlation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What Log Correlation Engines (if any) should correlate against
this repository.  A list of configured LCE numeric IDs is
supplied.  This option is used on IPv4, IPv6, and agent formats.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>nessus_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the .Nessus file generation schedule for IPv4 and IPv6
repository formats.  This option should only be used if there
is a need to consume the Repository in a raw Nessus XML format.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>mobile_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, this option will inform
Tenable.sc how often to perform the MDM synchronization into the
repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>orgs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of Organization IDs used to assign the repository to 1 or
many organizations.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>preferences</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using a mobile repository type, this dictionary details
the required preferences to inject into the backend scan needed
to communicate to the MDM solution.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_ip</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the IP
address of the Tenable.sc instance that the repository will be
pulled from.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the numeric ID
of the repository on the remote host that will be pulled.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the schedule
dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how often to synchronize
with the downstream Tenable.sc instance.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scanner_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, we must specify the
scanner from which to query the MDM source.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trending</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days of trending snapshots should be created for this
repository.  This value is only used for IPv4, IPv6, and agent
repositories.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The repository resource record for the newly created Repo.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example IPv4&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.export_repository">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">export_repository</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fobj</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.export_repository"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.export_repository" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Exports the repository and writes the archive tarball into the file
object passed.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#RepositoryRESTReference-/repository/{repository_id}/export">repository: export</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>repository_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id associated to the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em>) – The file-like object for the repository archive.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The export response record.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Example</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;repo.tar.gz&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;wb&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">archive</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">export_repository</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">archive</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.import_repository">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">import_repository</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fobj</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.import_repository"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.repositories.RepositoryAPI.import_repository" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Imports the repository archive for an offline repository.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#RepositoryRESTReference-/repository/{repository_id}/import">repository: import</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name for the respository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>allowed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Allowed IPs will restrict incoming data being inserted into the
repository to only the IPs that exist within the configured
CIDR ranges.  Accepts a list of CIDR strings based on the
repository format (IPv4 or IPv6).  If left unspecified, then it
will default to the CIDR equivalent of “allow all” for that IP
version.  IPv4=0.0.0.0/0, IPv6=::/0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>format</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The format of the repository.  Valid choices are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">agent</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IPv4</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IPv6</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">mobile</span></code>.  The default if unspecified
is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">IPv4</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fulltext_search</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should full-text searching be enabled?  This option is used for
IPv4, IPv6, and agent repository formats and determins whether
the plugin output is trended along with the normalized data.  If
left unspecified, the default is set to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_correlation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What Log Correlation Engines (if any) should correlate against
this repository.  A list of configured LCE numeric IDs is
supplied.  This option is used on IPv4, IPv6, and agent formats
and is defaulted to nothing if left unspecified.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>nessus_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the .Nessus file generation schedule for IPv4 and IPv6
repository formats.  This option should only be used if there
is a need to consume the Repository in a raw Nessus XML format.
If left unspecified, it will default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>mobile_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, this option will inform
Tenable.sc how often to perform the MDM synchronization into the
repository.  If left unspecified, it will default to
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>orgs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of Organization IDs used to assign the repository to 1 or
many organizations.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>preferences</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using a mobile repository type, this dictionary details
the required preferences to inject into the backend scan needed
to communicate to the MDM solution.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_ip</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the IP
address of the Tenable.sc instance that the repository will be
pulled from.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the numeric ID
of the repository on the remote host that will be pulled.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the schedule
dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how often to synchronize
with the downstream Tenable.sc instance.  If left unspecified
then we will default to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'type':</span> <span class="pre">'never'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What type of repository is this?  Valid choices are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Local</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Remote</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Offline</span></code>.  The default if unspecified is
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Local</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scanner_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, we must specify the
scanner from which to query the MDM source.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trending</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days of trending snapshots should be created for this
repository.  This value is only used for IPv4, IPv6, and agent
repositories.  If not supplied, the default will be 0.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The repository resource record for the newly created Repo.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Creating a new IPv4 Repository leveraging the defaults:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example IPv4&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a new IPv4 Repository with 90 days of trending and linked
to the first Organization:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Trending&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">trending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">90</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orgs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating an IPv6 repository:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example IPv6&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;IPv6&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating an agent repository:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Agent&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;agent&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating an MDM repository for ActiveSync that will sync every day
at 6am eastern:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example ActiveSync&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">mdm_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scanner_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="nb">format</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;mobile&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">orgs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">mobile_sched</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;repeatRule&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;FREQ=DAILY;INTERVAL=1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;start&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;TZID=America/New_York:20190212T060000&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ical&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="p">},</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">preferences</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;domain&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;AD_DOMAIN&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;domain_admin&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;DA_ACCOUNT_NAME&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;domain_controller&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;dc1.company.tld&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;password&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;DA_ACCOUNT_PASSWORD&#39;</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
<p>Creating a new repository to remotely sync the downstream Tenable.sc
instance’s repository 1 to this host and institute trending for 90
days:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example Remote Repo&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">repo_type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Remote&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remote_ip</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.101&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remote_repo</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">trending</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">90</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">orgs</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">remote_sched</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;type&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ical&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;start&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;TZID=America/NewYork:20190212T060000&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>        <span class="s1">&#39;repeatRule&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;FREQ=DAILY;INTERVAL=1&#39;</span>
<span class="gp">... </span><span class="p">})</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id124">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">delete</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.delete"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id124" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>

</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id125">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">details</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.details"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id125" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dl class="field-list simple">

<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The list of fields that are desired to be returned.  For details

</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>

</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id126">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">device_info</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">dns</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">ip_address</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">uuid</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fields</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.device_info"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id126" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Retrieves the device information for the requested device on the
associated repository.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#RepositoryRESTReference-/repository/{repository_id}/deviceInfo">repository: device info</a></p>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>repository_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id for the repository to query.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>dns</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The DNS name to query</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fields</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The list of fields that are desired to be returned.  For details
on what fields are available, please refer to the details on the
request within the repository device info API doc.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ip_address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The IP address to query</p></li>
<li><p><strong>uuid</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The UUID to query.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The device resource.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">host</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">device_info</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ip_address</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;192.168.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id127">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repository_id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kwargs</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/repositories.md#RepositoryAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id127" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Updates an existing repository</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Repository.html#repository_id_PATCH">repository: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>repository_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The numeric id of the repository to edit.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>allowed_ips</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Allowed IPs will restrict incoming data being inserted into the
repository to only the IPs that exist within the configured
CIDR ranges.  Accepts a list of CIDR strings based on the
repository format (IPv4 or IPv6).</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>lce_correlation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What Log Correlation Engines (if any) should correlate against
this repository.  A list of configured LCE numeric IDs is
supplied.  This option is used on IPv4, IPv6, and agent formats.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name for the repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>nessus_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – This is the .Nessus file generation schedule for IPv4 and IPv6
repository formats.  This option should only be used if there
is a need to consume the Repository in a raw Nessus XML format.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>mobile_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, this option will inform
Tenable.sc how often to perform the MDM synchronization into the
repository.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>orgs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of Organization IDs used to assign the repository to 1 or
many organizations.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>preferences</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using a mobile repository type, this dictionary details
the required preferences to inject into the backend scan needed
to communicate to the MDM solution.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_ip</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the IP
address of the Tenable.sc instance that the repository will be
pulled from.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the numeric ID
of the repository on the remote host that will be pulled.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>remote_sched</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When the Remote repository type is used, this is the schedule
dictionary that will inform Tenable.sc how often to synchronize
with the downstream Tenable.sc instance.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scanner_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – When using the mobile repository format, we must specify the
scanner from which to query the MDM source.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>trending</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days of trending snapshots should be created for this
repository.  This value is only used for IPv4, IPv6, and agent
repositories.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The repository resource record for the newly created Repo.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">repo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">repositories</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example IPv4&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<section id="module-tenable.sc.scan_instances">
<span id="tenable-sc-scan-instances-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.scan_instances module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.scan_instances" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="scan-instances">
<h3>Scan Instances<a class="headerlink" href="#scan-instances" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Result.html">Scan Result</a> API.  While the Tenable.sc API refers
to the model these endpoints interact with as <em>ScanResult</em>, were actually
interacting with an instance of a scan definition stored within the <em>Scan</em> API
endpoints.  These scan instances could be running scans, stopped scans, errored
scans, or completed scans.  These items are typically seen under the
<strong>Scan Results</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.scan_instances</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">

<dd><dl class="py method">

<dd><p>Clones the scan instance.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan-Result.html#ScanResultRESTReference-/scanResult/{id}/copy">scan-result: copy</a></p>

<li><p><strong>*users</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – A user id to associate to the scan instance.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>

</dd>
</dl>

<p class="rubric">Examples</p>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.scan_instances.ScanResultAPI.export_scan">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">export_scan</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">fobj</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">export_format</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">None</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/scan_instances.md#ScanResultAPI.export_scan"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.scan_instances.ScanResultAPI.export_scan" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The scan instance identifier.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>export_format</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The format of the resulting data.  Allowable values are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scap1_2</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">v2</span></code>.  <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">v2</span></code> is the default value if none
are specified.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The file-like object to write the resulting file into.  If
no file-like object is provided, a BytesIO objects with the
downloaded file will be returned.  Be aware that the default
option of using a BytesIO object means that the file will be
stored in memory, and it’s generally recommended to pass an
actual file-object to write to instead.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The file-like object with the resulting zipped report.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">FileObject</span></code></p>
</dd>

<li><p><strong>zone_ids</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – List of scan zones that this scanner is to be a member of.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly updated scanner.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>

</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>
