<section id="module-tenable.sc.scans">
<span id="tenable-sc-scans-module"></span><h2>tenable.sc.scans module<a class="headerlink" href="#module-tenable.sc.scans" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h2>
<section id="scans">
<h3>Scans<a class="headerlink" href="#scans" title="Permalink to this headline">¶</a></h3>
<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc
<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan.html">Scan</a> API.  While the api endpoints obliquely refers to the
model in which this collection of actions modifies as “Scans”, Tenable.sc is
actually referring to the scan <em>definitions</em>, which are the un-launched and/or
scheduled scans typically seen within the <strong>Active Scans</strong> section within
Tenable.sc.</p>
<p>Methods available on <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sc.scans</span></code>:</p>
<dl class="py class hide-signature">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI">
<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">ScanAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/scans.md#ScanAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.copy">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">copy</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">user_id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/scans.md#ScanAPI.copy"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.copy" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Copies an existing scan definition.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan.html#ScanRESTReference-/scan/{id}/copyScanCopyPOST">scan: copy</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The scan definition identifier to copy.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name of the copy that’s created.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>user_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The user id to assign as the owner of the new scan definition.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>Scan definition resource.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scans</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">copy</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Cloned Scan&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.create">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">create</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">repo</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/scans.md#ScanAPI.create"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.create" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Creates a scan definition.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan.html#scan_POST">scan: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The repository id for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>auto_mitigation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days to hold on to data before mitigating it?  The
default value is 0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_lists</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of asset list ids to run the scan against.  A logical OR
will be performed to compute what hosts to scan against.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>creds</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of credential ids to use for the purposes of this scan.
This list should be treated as an un-ordered list of credentials.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_complete</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon completion of the scan?  The
default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_launch</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon launching the scan?  The default
is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>host_tracking</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should DHCP host tracking be enabled?  The default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>max_time</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The maximum amount of time that the scan may run in seconds.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code> or less for unlimited.
The default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3600</span></code> seconds.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>policy_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The policy id to use for a policy-based scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>plugin_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The plugin id to use for a plugin-based scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>reports</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What reports should be run upon completion of the scan?  Each
report dictionary requires an id for the report definition and
the source for which to run the report against.  Example:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'id':</span> <span class="pre">1,</span> <span class="pre">'reportSource':</span> <span class="pre">'individual'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rollover</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should rollover scans be created (assuming the scan is
configured to create a rollover scan with the timeout action).
The available actions are to automatically start the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">nextDay</span></code>
at the same time the scan was originally configured to run, and
to generate a rollover <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">template</span></code>.  The default action is to
generate a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">template</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_zone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The zone identifier to use for the scan.  If non is selected
then the default of “0” or “All Zones” is selected.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A dictionary detailing the repeating schedule of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>targets</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of valid targets.  These targets could be IPs, FQDNs,
CIDRs, or IP ranges.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timeout</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should an incomplete scan be handled?  The available actions
are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">discard</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">import</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">rollover</span></code>.  The default
action is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">import</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vhosts</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should virtual host logic be enabled for the scan?  The default
is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The scan resource for the created scan.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Creating a scan for a single host:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scans</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example scan&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">policy_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1001</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">targets</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;127.0.0.1&#39;</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.delete">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">delete</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/scans.md#ScanAPI.delete"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.delete" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="tenable.sc.scans.ScanAPI.edit">

<dd><p>Edits an existing scan definition.</p>

<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The identifier for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>auto_mitigation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days to hold on to data before mitigating it?</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_lists</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of asset list ids to run the scan against.  A logical OR
will be performed to compute what hosts to scan against.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>creds</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of credential ids to use for the purposes of this scan.
This list should be treated as an un-ordered list of credentials.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_complete</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon completion of the scan?</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_launch</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon launching the scan?</p></li>
<li><p><strong>host_tracking</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should DHCP host tracking be enabled?</p></li>
<li><p><strong>max_time</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The maximum amount of time that the scan may run in seconds.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code> or less for unlimited.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>policy</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The policy id to use for a policy-based scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>plugin</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The plugin id to use for a plugin-based scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>reports</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What reports should be run upon completion of the scan?  Each
report dictionary requires an id for the report definition and
the source for which to run the report against.  Example:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'id':</span> <span class="pre">1,</span> <span class="pre">'reportSource':</span> <span class="pre">'individual'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The repository id for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rollover</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should rollover scans be created (assuming the scan is
configured to create a rollover scan with the timeout action).
The available actions are to automatically start the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">nextDay</span></code>
at the same time the scan was originally configured to run, and
to generate a rollover <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">template</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_zone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The zone identifier to use for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A dictionary detailing the repeating schedule of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>targets</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of valid targets.  These targets could be IPs, FQDNs,
CIDRs, or IP ranges.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timeout</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should an incomplete scan be handled?  The available actions
are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">discard</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">import</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">rollover</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vhosts</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should virtual host logic be enabled for the scan?</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The scan resource for the created scan.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<p>Editing an existing scan’s name:</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">scans</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;Example scan&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

</dd>
</dl>

<dd><p>Creates a scan definition.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/Scan.html#scan_POST">scan: create</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The name of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>repo</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The repository id for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>auto_mitigation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days to hold on to data before mitigating it?  The
default value is 0.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>asset_lists</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of asset list ids to run the scan against.  A logical OR
will be performed to compute what hosts to scan against.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>creds</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of credential ids to use for the purposes of this scan.
This list should be treated as an un-ordered list of credentials.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>description</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A description for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_complete</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon completion of the scan?  The
default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_launch</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon launching the scan?  The default
is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>host_tracking</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should DHCP host tracking be enabled?  The default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>max_time</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The maximum amount of time that the scan may run in seconds.
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code> or less for unlimited.
The default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">3600</span></code> seconds.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>policy_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The policy id to use for a policy-based scan.</p></li>

<li><p><strong>reports</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What reports should be run upon completion of the scan?  Each

the source for which to run the report against.  Example:
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">{'id':</span> <span class="pre">1,</span> <span class="pre">'reportSource':</span> <span class="pre">'individual'}</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>rollover</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should rollover scans be created (assuming the scan is
configured to create a rollover scan with the timeout action).
The available actions are to automatically start the <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">nextDay</span></code>

to generate a rollover <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">template</span></code>.  The default action is to
generate a <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">template</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>scan_zone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The zone identifier to use for the scan.  If non is selected
then the default of “0” or “All Zones” is selected.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A dictionary detailing the repeating schedule of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>targets</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of valid targets.  These targets could be IPs, FQDNs,
CIDRs, or IP ranges.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timeout</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should an incomplete scan be handled?  The available actions

action is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">import</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>vhosts</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should virtual host logic be enabled for the scan?  The default
is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">False</span></code>.</p></li>

<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">

<li><p><strong>auto_mitigation</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How many days to hold on to data before mitigating it?</p></li>

<li><p><strong>email_complete</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon completion of the scan?</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_launch</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should we notify the owner upon launching the scan?</p></li>

<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code> or less for unlimited.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>name</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The name of the scan.</p></li>

<li><p><strong>rollover</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should rollover scans be created (assuming the scan is

<li><p><strong>scan_zone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The zone identifier to use for the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>schedule</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>dict</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A dictionary detailing the repeating schedule of the scan.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>targets</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of valid targets.  These targets could be IPs, FQDNs,

<li><p><strong>timeout</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – How should an incomplete scan be handled?  The available actions

</ul>

<dd><p>Generates and downloads a diagnostic file for the purpose of
troubleshooting an ailing Tenable.sc instance.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/System.html#SystemRESTReference-/system/diagnostics/generate">system: diagnostics-generate</a></p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/System.html#SystemRESTReference-/system/diagnostics/download">system: diagnostics-download</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>fobj</strong> (<em>FileObject</em><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The file-like object to write the diagnostics file to.  If
nothing is specified, a BytesIO object will be returnbed with
the file.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>options</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If performing a diagnostics generation, then which items
should be bundled into the diagnostics file?  Available options
are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">apacheLog</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">configuration</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dependencies</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dirlist</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">environment</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">installLog</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">logs</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sanitize</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scans</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">serverConf</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setup</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sysinfo</span></code>,
and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">upgradeLog</span></code>.  If nothing is specified, it will default to
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">['all']</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>task</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Which task to perform.  Available options are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">appStatus</span></code> and
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">diagnosticsFile</span></code>.  If nothing is specified, it will default
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">diagnosticFile</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>A file-like object with the diagnostics file specified.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">FileObject</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="k">with</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;diagnostics.tar.gz&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;wb&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">fobj</span><span class="p">:</span>
<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">system</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diagnostics</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fobj</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fobj</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

should be bundled into the diagnostics file?  Available options
are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">all</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">apacheLog</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">configuration</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dependencies</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dirlist</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">environment</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">installLog</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">logs</span></code>,
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sanitize</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">scans</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">serverConf</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">setup</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">sysinfo</span></code>,
and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">upgradeLog</span></code>.  If nothing is specified, it will default to
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">['all']</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>task</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Which task to perform.  Available options are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">appStatus</span></code> and
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">diagnosticsFile</span></code>.  If nothing is specified, it will default
to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">diagnosticFile</span></code>.</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>A file-like object with the diagnostics file specified.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">FileObject</span></code></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>

<span class="gp">... </span>    <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">system</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">diagnostics</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fobj</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fobj</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>

<p>The following methods allow for interaction into the Tenable.sc

<strong>Users</strong> section of Tenable.sc.</p>

<em class="property"><span class="pre">class</span><span class="w"> </span></em><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">UserAPI</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">api</span></span><span class="p"><span class="pre">:</span></span><span class="w"> </span><span class="n"><a class="reference external" href="https://restfly.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/session.html#restfly.session.APISession" title="(in RESTfly v1.4.6)"><span class="pre">restfly.session.APISession</span></a></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/users.md#UserAPI"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#tenable.sc.users.UserAPI" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>

<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The username for the account</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a>) – The password for the user to create</p></li>
<li><p><strong>role</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a>) – The role that should be assigned to this user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Optional street address information to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Authentication type to use for the user.  Valid options are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">legacy</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">saml</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tns</span></code>.  If left unspecified
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tns</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>city</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Optional city information to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>country</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Optional country information to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>default_dashboards</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the default dashboards be created for the user?  If left

<li><p><strong>default_reportcards</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the default report cards be created for the user?  If

<li><p><strong>default_reports</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the default reports be created for the user?  If left

<li><p><strong>email</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The email address to associate to the user.</p></li>

<li><p><strong>firstname</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A first name to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>group</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A group to associate to the user.  This parameter is required

<li><p><strong>is_locked</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If the account locked?  If left unspecified the default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If specifying an LDAP auth type, this is the numeric identifier

<li><p><strong>managed_usergroups</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of group ids that the user is allowed to manage users

<li><p><strong>managed_userobjs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of group ids that the user is allowed to manage objects

<li><p><strong>org</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If logged in as an administrator, and creating a security

inform Tenable.sc which organization to create the security

<li><p><strong>phone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A phone number to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>responsibility</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The asset list detailing what assets the user is responsible

<li><p><strong>state</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The state to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timezone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A timezone other than the system timezone to associate to the

<li><p><strong>title</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A title to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>update_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the user be forced to update their password next login?

</ul>

<dl class="py method">
<dt class="sig sig-object py" id="id189">
<span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">edit</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">id</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="o"><span class="pre">**</span></span><span class="n"><span class="pre">kw</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="reference internal" href="_modules/tenable/sc/users.md#UserAPI.edit"><span class="viewcode-link"><span class="pre">[source]</span></span></a><a class="headerlink" href="#id189" title="Permalink to this definition">¶</a></dt>
<dd><p>Edits a user.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.tenable.com/sccv/api/User.html#user_id_PATCH">user: edit</a></p>
<dl class="field-list simple">
<dt class="field-odd">Parameters</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><ul class="simple">
<li><p><strong>address</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Optional street address information to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>auth_type</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The Authentication type to use for the user.  Valid options are
<code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">ldap</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">legacy</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">saml</span></code>, and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tns</span></code>.  If left unspecified
the default is <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">tns</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>city</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Optional city information to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>country</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Optional country information to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>default_dashboards</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the default dashboards be created for the user?  If left
unspecified, the default is True.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>default_reportcards</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the default report cards be created for the user?  If
left unspecified, the default is True.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>default_reports</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the default reports be created for the user?  If left
unspecified, the default is True.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The email address to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>email_notice</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – What type of events should generate an email notification?
Valid types are <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">id</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">password</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">both</span></code>, <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">none</span></code>.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fax</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A fax number to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>fingerprint</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A fingerprint to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>firstname</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A first name to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>group</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A group to associate to the user.  This parameter is required
for users that are not Administrators.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>is_locked</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If the account locked?  If left unspecified the default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>ldap_id</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If specifying an LDAP auth type, this is the numeric identifier
for the LDAP configuration to use.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>managed_usergroups</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of group ids that the user is allowed to manage users
within.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>managed_userobjs</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>list</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A list of group ids that the user is allowed to manage objects
within.  This includes asset lists, reports, etc.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>org</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – If logged in as an administrator, and creating a security
manager account, the organization id must be passed in order to
inform Tenable.sc which organization to create the security
manager within.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The user password</p></li>
<li><p><strong>phone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A phone number to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>responsibility</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The asset list detailing what assets the user is responsible
for.  A value of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">0</span></code> denotes all assets, any other non-zero
integer must be the id of the asset list to associate to the
user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>role</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>int</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The role that should be assigned to this user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>state</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The state to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>timezone</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A timezone other than the system timezone to associate to the
user.  This will impact all times displayed within the user
interface.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>title</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – A title to associate to the user.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>update_password</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>bool</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – Should the user be forced to update their password next login?
If left unspecified, the default is False.</p></li>
<li><p><strong>username</strong> (<a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" title="(in Python v3.10)"><em>str</em></a><em>, </em><em>optional</em>) – The username for the account</p></li>
</ul>
</dd>
<dt class="field-even">Returns</dt>
<dd class="field-even"><p>The newly updated user.</p>
</dd>
<dt class="field-odd">Return type</dt>
<dd class="field-odd"><p><a class="reference external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" title="(in Python v3.10)"><code class="xref py py-obj docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">dict</span></code></a></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<p class="rubric">Examples</p>
<div class="doctest highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="gp">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="n">user</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sc</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">users</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;newusername&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</dd></dl>
